function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Digital technology extracting intimate health information from water and wastewater-related services","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of human wastewater to track diseases","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on sewage-based monitoring for disease detection","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Monitoring wastewater effluents from hospitals for virus spread","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Safe working conditions and protective equipment required for water utility staff","category":"Health Protection","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective conventional treatment for pharmaceutical compounds may lead to water contamination","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in wastewater concentration and decrease in flow may lead to the accumulation of solids, causing odors, corrosion, and equipment damage.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of flushable material such as toilet wipes and protective masks in wastewater may cause clogging of sewer systems and pumping stations.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in concentration of pharmaceutical products in wastewater may lead to environmental contamination and health risks.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of diseases in the built environment due to close proximity and shared spaces.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary or intermittent measures that mitigate the risk of transmission without bringing long-term sustainability benefits.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Risk of poor air quality and ventilation contributing to the spread of diseases, including covid-19, in non-residential buildings.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate alterations to the built environment in response to contagious diseases","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of infectious diseases in interconnected urban areas","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for virus residence on surfaces and materials","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation and airflow in buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Building solutions not directly reducing transmission of sars-cov-2 or other viruses","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to outdoor spaces for residents in buildings","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and sunlight in enclosed balconies","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural green spaces and amenities in the building’s surrounding environment","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination due to inefficient waste collection systems","category":"Waste Management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accumulation of viruses in buildings due to carpets and rugs","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate building entrances contributing to pathogen transfer","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of isolation facilities for infected residents in housing buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of energy supply during a pandemic","category":"Energy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of touch-free technologies and digital controls in information systems","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate waste management contributing to viral transmission","category":"Waste Management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cross-contamination risk due to inadequate hvac systems","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate wastewater management and monitoring leading to the spread of infectious diseases through faecal-oral transmission, such as covid-19.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation systems in closed buildings, leading to poor air circulation and increased transmission of infectious diseases.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of expensive materials such as copper","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Viral activity inside buildings posing a risk of disease transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural light and ventilation in buildings impacting public health","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient green areas in urban zones","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective selection of materials and ventilation systems in buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for airborne transmission of infectious diseases in enclosed spaces","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rubbish bags as potential vectors of disease transmission","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incineration emitting polluting gases","category":"Environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on unreliable energy supply","category":"Energy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of natural light on virus activity","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of wastewater and waste collection systems on virus transmission","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of interior finishes on virus transmission","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of differentiation between entrance and exit doors","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safety distance markers in waiting areas and stops","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-risk environment in public transport","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of historical pandemics on urban design","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adaptation of historical structures for new roles","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended urbanisation and informal public areas increase vulnerability to infectious diseases due to demographic factors, infrastructure, and governance.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Built environment can create conditions for the spread of specific diseases, such as legionnaire’s disease, through factors like air conditioning, indoor plumbing, and hot water systems.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"}]}
